title: K-12 AI Readiness Assessment
description: Comprehensive assessment for K-12 districts evaluating AI readiness across instruction, operations, and governance.

sections.title: Leadership & Governance
sections.description: District leadership understanding and governance structures for AI

questions.question: Does your district have a formal AI policy or set of guidelines?

options.text: Yes, we have comprehensive AI policies covering student and staff use
Yes, we have basic guidelines or draft policies
We have informal guidelines but no official policy
No, we don't have any AI policies or guidelines

questions.question: How would you describe your superintendent's understanding of AI in education?

options.text: Expert level - actively leads AI discussions and strategy
Advanced - strong understanding and supportive of AI initiatives
Basic - general awareness but limited depth
Minimal - little knowledge or engagement with AI topics

questions.question: Which governance bodies have discussed AI implementation in your district?

sections.title: Curriculum & Instruction
sections.description: Integration of AI tools and concepts in teaching and learning

questions.question: What is your district's current stance on student use of AI tools (like ChatGPT) for academic work?

options.text: Encouraged with proper training and guidelines
Restricted to specific situations or subjects

questions.question: How prepared are your teachers to integrate AI tools into their instruction?
Which AI-related topics are currently addressed in your curriculum?

sections.title: Professional Development
sections.description: Staff training and development for AI integration

questions.question: Has your district provided professional development on AI for educators?

options.text: Yes, one or more workshops or presentations
No formal or informal training provided

questions.question: Which stakeholder groups have received AI-related training or information?

sections.title: Technology Infrastructure
sections.description: Technical capacity and infrastructure for AI implementation

questions.question: How would you rate your district's current technology infrastructure for supporting AI tools?

options.text: Excellent - robust infrastructure ready for AI implementation
Good - adequate with minor upgrades needed

questions.question: What technology challenges might limit AI implementation in your district?

sections.title: Data Privacy & Security
sections.description: Data governance and privacy considerations for AI implementation

questions.question: Does your district have established procedures for evaluating AI tools' data privacy and security?

options.text: Yes, formal evaluation process with documented procedures

questions.question: Which privacy regulations does your district actively consider when evaluating AI tools?

options.text: FERPA (Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act)

levels.description: District is in early stages of AI awareness with limited policies or implementation.
recommendations: Develop foundational AI policies and guidelines
Provide leadership training on AI in education

levels.description: District has basic AI understanding with some policies and limited implementation.
recommendations: Pilot AI tools in select classrooms
Enhance governance structures for AI oversight

levels.description: District demonstrates solid AI readiness with comprehensive policies and active implementation.
recommendations: Share best practices with other districts

levels.description: District is an AI leader with comprehensive integration and strong governance.
recommendations: Mentor other districts in AI implementation
Research and pilot cutting-edge AI applications
Contribute to AI in education best practices
